intro: Lobelia orabensis, commonly known as the Indian tobacco, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features showy blue to purple tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It is part of the Campanulaceae family and is known for its medicinal properties historically used by Native American tribes. The plant's unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
